content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No Lab structure has been successfully placed. The agent’s operations have instead relied on existing smelting facilities to process ores:
  
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position (5.0, 5.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace (located at Position(5.0, 5.0))
Use-case: Processes iron ore into iron plates for resource conversion.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace (located at Position(-27.0, -60.0))
Use-case: Processes copper ore into copper plates to enable subsequent production steps.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Function Usage Errors  
 – Using get_entities with an unexpected keyword (e.g. “radius”) or with incorrect positional arguments causes TypeErrors.  
  ✓ Tip: Verify the API signature and pass parameters exactly as required (either using the correct positional order or supported keywords).

• Entity Placement and Inventory Verification  
 – Attempts to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) failed because the lab was not present in inventory.  
  ✓ Tip: Always confirm that the necessary item exists in inventory and the target tile is free before attempting placement.

• Iterating Over Null Returns  
 – Filtering operations on the result of get_entities led to “NoneType” is not iterable errors.  
  ✓ Tip: Check that the returned entity list is not None before iterating.

• Crafting Resource Shortages in Lab Production  
 – Lab crafting repeatedly failed due to missing sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables).  
  ✓ Tip: Ensure that all required intermediate products are available and that proper resource processing (including smelting and component production) has been completed before attempting to craft complex items like the Lab.
